item.title: Introduction to Multithreading
item.description: Understand the basics of multithreading in Java — what threads are, how they work, advantages, disadvantages, and real-world applications.

item.title: Write Your First Java Program
item.description:
Let’s Write Our First Java Program

Creating your first Java program is an exciting milestone.
In this lesson, you’ll learn how to:

  • Write a simple Java program
  • Compile the .java source file
  • Run the compiled bytecode
  • Understand the basic program structure

This will give you the foundation needed for all future Java development.

1. Before You Begin

Ensure that:

✔ You have installed the Java Development Kit (JDK)
✔ Environment variables (JAVA_HOME and PATH) are set
✔ You have an IDE or text editor ready

item.title: History Of Programming
item.description:
1. The Origin of Programming

Early Beginnings:

The journey of programming begins in the 19th century with visionary minds like Charles Babbage and Ada Lovelace. Babbage, often called the “father of the computer,” conceptualized the Analytical Engine, a mechanical general-purpose computer. Ada Lovelace, a mathematician and writer, is credited with creating the first algorithm intended to be processed by a machine, making her the world’s first programmer. Her notes on the Analytical Engine include what is recognized today as the first algorithm designed for implementation on a computer.

item.title: Arrays Basic (1D & 2D Arrays)
item.description:
Arrays Basics (1D & 2D) – Core Concepts with Java Examples

Arrays are one of the most fundamental data structures in computer science. They store elements of the same type in contiguous memory locations and provide fast random access using indices. Arrays are essential for building more complex data structures and solving algorithmic problems efficiently.

1. What is an Array?

An array is a fixed-size, indexed collection of elements of the same data type, stored in contiguous memory.

item.title: Creating Threads in Java
item.description: Learn how to create threads using Thread, Runnable, Callable, and Future — along with best practices for scalable, maintainable, and efficient multithreading in Java.

item.title: Java Virtual Machine (JVM)
item.description: Understand how the JVM executes Java programs — covering class loading, bytecode interpretation, JIT compilation, and memory management.

item.title: About
item.description:
Meet Me

Welcome to my creative corner! I’m Shubham, a senior software developer with a background in Electronics and Communication Engineering. I have a passion for exploring various hobbies and sharing my experiences with the world.

As a coding aficionado, I enjoy diving into the world of technology, learning new programming languages, and sharing tutorials to help others master coding concepts. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced developer, you’ll find resources here to enhance your skills and stay updated with the latest trends in the tech industry.
